website_summaries.verdict: This cordless power tool goes from trimming to edging with ease, and can even function as a mini-mower for tight areas.
pros: Transitions from trimmer to wheeled edger with a few adjustments
Adjustable height with more length for taller users
Instant line feeding with Command Feed Spool
Adjustable spacer guard to control where trimmer cuts and protect flowers and ornaments
Rubberized twin wheel set for use with edger
cons: Battery takes a long time to charge

customer_reviews.title: lighter than a gas powered tool
customer_reviews.text: Despite the weight of the battery, this is easier for this 82 yr old. Battery lasts about as long as I do.
customer_reviews.author: okie paperlady

customer_reviews.title: The wheel keeps falling off.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and plenty of power. Only disappointing feature is the wheel doe not stay on and this is why I bought it. My shoulder and neck can not put up with holding it for over 15 minutes at a time. Thought the wheel would relieve that problem! Otherwise, it's excellent and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Zip

customer_reviews.title: Same as WG 163
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself some money and buy the WG163. Same batteries, same length, same weak motor and countless string changes. The motor is so weak that in it slows down and pushes the grass side to side. I think only thing that's cutting the grass is the twisted string. I fed it so much thinking that the line was too but that's wasn't the case. Get something with more power. keeping this for a back up since my gas trimmer is so unreliable and hard to run. This will at least get you moving every time. Returning this and keeping the WG163. Bought both to see which was better...
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome weed eater/edger. Works great! Battery works and last relatively well. Begin to notice a slight decrease in power towards the end of both yards. However, still does it’s job. Will purchase again. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: have lots of worx products and performs as expected ... batteries last about 40 minutes on a full charge
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Scanlan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as adveryised
customer_reviews.text: This product would not trim grass very well around buildings and flower beds. The power was just not there. I was so disappointed because I am old and really need something light weight. This product is light weight but does not work well.
customer_reviews.author: ElsieDawson

customer_reviews.title: Fast, lightweight, and easy
customer_reviews.text: I got this weed eater/edger a couple of weeks ago and finally got brave enough to give it a try. Ohmygawd it’s so easy and does a great job. I haven’t done a yard in 15 years and you can’t even tell I’m out of practice. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is very light duty and fragile. Batteries do not last long at all and the recharging time is ridiculous. I used one time and the trim shear was gone. The blower that I purchased as a package won't last hardly ten minutes on a full charge. I feel ripped off for the price and will never buy a Worx product again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gimmick of a weed trimmer/edger. Decent battery life but the trimmer doesn’t cut well and the lifetime string is worthless
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Worse battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. I was pleased with the 24volt worx trimmer I owned since 2013, and the worx blower I have for many years. When the trimmer stopped working about three weeks ago I decided to buy this product. This 20 volt trimmer is surprisingly much less powerful than the 24 volt printer. It cuts regular grass but struggles to cut crabgrass and other weeds. The battery life is the absolute worst- the first time I used it the battery, which was fully charged, died after about 15 minutes of use. The second time I used it, with the second fully charged battery, it couldn’t cut an area 2ft by 3ft in the sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: If you expect a work horse don't get this one
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something light weight, and with adjustable height, which this fits the bill. But with how small the trimming string is ,its not even 2 coming out of it,so it is very weak in cutting. if you have anything more then a blades of light grass this will not cut it , The only reason I am not sending it back because, my husband likes that it cuts most of the grass by the fence with more control and ease ,then our heavier weed eater ,or the gas edger .
customer_reviews.author: crisssyee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is maybe 15 minutes for a fully charged unit. That’s my main complaint at this time. It’s not particularly powerful but I guess for a battery charged tool you just can’t expect much. I’ll continue to use it because I have no choice but to, but I’m not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Caren Corkins

customer_reviews.title: Had to order a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return due to wheel not locking in place when used as a mini lawnmower. Battery life was terrible lasted about 10 minutes if that, not to mention only 1 battery was included when the package read 2 batteries included. The mower looked used as if some one had dropped it and tried to wipe it down. It even had a hair on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mary2go

customer_reviews.title: Battery life very poor
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is extremely poor. I have about 1/2 hour of trimming and could not finish USING BOTH BATTERIES. About 10 minutes per battery. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Harold B

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied- cheaply made and no power!
customer_reviews.text: First one I received had a defective lock on the head. Amazon promptly replaced it of course. Now after using it I am not happy at all. I bought this for the wheels. They are cheap plastic and fall off constantly. The whole thing is just flimsy and it has no power. For the money they charge I expected a much better quality product. Pretty sure I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra3755

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's so light and works great. I hated dealing with mixing gas and oil. Battery powered is much cleaner and easier to use. This is for light duty and wouldn't recommend for professional applications. Construction is plastic and versatile but cheaply made and don't think it would be suited for heavy rugged use. I still have a Husqvarna gas/oil unit that is metal and very durable. It's heavy and loud. I prefer the Worx if I can use. I worry I may break it if I push it to far to its limit. Plastic can crack and break. So far so good. I would recommend for the typical home owner with a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Turk

customer_reviews.title: Too weak to be effective
customer_reviews.text: The actual cutting capacity is minimal. The battery seems to die after 20 minutes as well. Unfortunately I missed the refund window.
customer_reviews.author: Darian Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice trimmer/edger
customer_reviews.text: We have a very nice greenworks trimmer but have been wanting to try the Worx GT for a while. Went out on a limb and purchased this since I was tired of having to do the trimmer then drag out my edger and power cords to do the edging. I am surprisingly impressed with how this works as a trimmer and an edger. My only complaint is the line does not seem to last very long as I go through roughly a spool each time I use it to trim the house, fence, and edge the driveway and sidewalks. It does however have enough juice to last the entire time but usually have to swap batteries about 30 minutes in.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wright

customer_reviews.title: Glad I received 2 batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to use and edges beautifully. Batteries charge very slowly and run out quickly. I use 2 batteries to do .61 acre lot. Excellent product otherwise and I don’t have to fight with the string feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Reflections Digital Life

customer_reviews.title: Even grandma likes to use this!
customer_reviews.text: We have had other battery operated trimmers, but this one blows them away. It is very lightweight, easy to adjust and trim. The cord in that little spool cuts anything and has lasted and lasted. Getting two batteries is helpful, but I can trim for a long time and have not had to stop and change batteries yet. This is a bit more pricey than competitors, but worth every penny more. My son has a gas powered one, but he is going to get one of these instead, more than adequate for his use. It pays to get the best.
customer_reviews.author: MJJ

customer_reviews.title: It was actually fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this weed eater. My son cuts my grass, and I made a deal with him. I will do the weed eating to make it easier on him. I cranked this machine up and off I went. It was more like fun than yard work. I did have trouble getting the guard to stay on, I couldn't make out on the directions where it should 'snap' in. It's probably against the rules, but I've been using it without the guard.
customer_reviews.author: D Plant

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I ordered this weed trimmer. It's light weight, no exhaust fumes, no messiness or pulling a cord repeatedly. The batteries last about 45 minutes between charges. We got the pkg with a charger and 2 batteries so one could be charging while the other was in use. We then bought the Worx blower which runs off the same battery and it's is also a super addition to our yard maintenance equipment. It blows harder than you would think and comes with several attachments. I recommend both products. I haven't had them for long but will update this review if there is a problem over time.
customer_reviews.author: susan waddell

customer_reviews.title: Does multiple jobs
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is my first battery operated lawn tool. So far I am impressed with the versatility and battery life. The only thing that is a little concerning is how long will all of the plastic parts in all of the joints that move will last. This is a piece of equipment that you cannot be rough with. If you are careful and understand what it takes to be as versatile as it is you will be OK. Customer service for Worx is good and the free spools of line for life is nice. Make sure that you register the product on the Worx website when you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Staab

customer_reviews.title: Half an hour for the Battery in heavy usage
customer_reviews.text: (My ONLY complaint) - I can get 30 minutes on a charge for using for heavy weed cutting. By heavy weed cutting I mean shaving down to the dirt around flower beds, culverts, diversion water channel, and around trees. It takes me two (20 volt batteries to do my front yard. I don't have enough left to do the entire back yard. One battery would not be enough to do a decent size front yard. (LIKES) Very light weight for a trimmer. (My wife likes this!) Easy to adjust, the line feed is new for me; so I am getting used to this.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing
customer_reviews.text: OMG it is so light and tons of power. It was light enough amd adjusts fir size for my 12 yr old to start helping. We did the front and back yards and still had 1/2 of a battery left. I have owned many gas and electric ones and this is hands down the best. The adjustable wheeled edger works like a champ. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Parijs

customer_reviews.title: WORX 4 me.......
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I have 3 batteries that I keep charged up. I do a lot of trimming with it. I can use 1 full charged battery everytime I mow. So I have heard other reviewers say the battery doesn't last, I've never had any trouble with it. I also have the Worx pressure washer, it works real well too. Mind you it isn't as strong as a gas or electric power washer, but it does a good job for me. I would highly recommend any Worx product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cards Fan 68

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. I have a small back yard and didn't want to pull out a full sized mower just to cut a small patch of fast growing grass! Now I can mow, edge and trim anytime I want. Can do my entire lawn with one battery! My only complaint is that the wheels that have to be moved to go from weed eater to edger are a bit tricky to get off and on. Still a great product - I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MASLubbock

customer_reviews.title: Functional but of limited use
customer_reviews.text: Solid basic product. Of limited use though, because it only seems to be able to cut through very light grass that is not too high. If the grass has grown taller and thicker, mixed with more fibrous weeds or similar, it does not penetrate this effectively. It’s made for easy grass lawns, of limited penetration and possibly durability. By contrast, I used to have a trimmer that would shred through anything, if your grass was overgrown and had weeds or anything thicker. That’s what I need. I will probably have to upgrade eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Seeeker

customer_reviews.title: wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: due to my back surgery, my wife has been doing the yard work. I ordered this so she could trim easily, it's much lighter and easier to run than my gas trimmer. This trimmer works great, so far the battery has lasted longer than what's needed to trim, even had plenty left after edging the drive and walk. The gas powered one is getting put in the next garage sale. The auto line release works great, some people have complained, but you need to keep the trimmer running to release more line, it will stop and go as it releases. This is a great little trimmer and I completely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nebraska gramps

customer_reviews.title: Misleading images provided for product.
customer_reviews.text: Not as pictured. The image provided shows a weed eater with a longer shaft. Unfortunately, this is shorter than expected. You can extend the weed eater longer, but it only extends about 4 inches. The image made it seem like someone that is over 5’5” would reasonably be comfortable and not hunched over. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: B. W.

customer_reviews.title: They really cheapened this up from my last GT
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the 36-volt GT for a few years. It finally gave out after using it at least twice a week. This new one is more cheaply built and doesn't have the power of the 36-volt model. What a shame. Same glitz, but no guts. I returned it and moved on. Too bad Worx discontinued the 36-volt model. You can buy a Worx 56-volt trimmer, but it doesn't have wheels. I still use the 36-volt hedge trimmer, but I will obviously need to find another brand when it dies. Very disappointed in Worx.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Worx: A Grass Trimmer That Works!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this outstanding trimmer for my bride. She researched trimmers and found this gem. Being a small lady, its description fit her needs and upon arrival and first use, she was very pleased. We have since purchased several other Worx yard tools and an additional battery. The whole system is worth consideration and the pricepoints allow quality on a budget. Ordering, turnaround, packaging were all an excellent shopping experience. I recommend this tool set.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer - Brodie

customer_reviews.title: The best trimmer/edger that I've ever used for my yard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this WORX WG170 GT Revolution (included 2 batteries) trimmer to replace a very old corded trimmer/edger. The old unit did not cut at consistent depths/heights. Also the old one did not have a pivoting head or an adjustable shaft and was awkward to use. This WORX trimmer/edger. has relocatable wheels to ensure consistent depths and cutting heights. Moving the wheel allows the product to be used as an edger or simple lawn mower. And being cordless is a real plus. So far this unit has lived up to the hype shown in the commercials.
customer_reviews.author: David Pollum

customer_reviews.title: Very handy. Very, very useful
customer_reviews.text: Edged my walk and driveway the other day and have received many compliments about how good the yard looks. This tool is just what I needed. It only has one string coming out. I was a bit miffed at first, but after using it, I am ecstatic. The command release button works flawlessly. That was the problem I had with every other weed eater I have tried. The string was always getting fouled up. Not with this one. Looking forward to many good years of service from this one.
customer_reviews.author: more peace

customer_reviews.title: A great lightweight unit
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with this unit. Very light weight and so easy to use. Like the adjustable shaft and the rotating head. We use it around the house and also visiting our loved ones grave sites when we cleanup there resting place. Very nice for that and quiet! That's a plus there!
customer_reviews.author: Seaweid

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this would be a lightweight garden tool. Lightweight but the battery life is not very good. Two batteries and a regular size yard and it doesn't complete. Disappointed with batteries, tool is adequate. Probably will not buy other products if this battery life is the norm.
customer_reviews.author: killian

customer_reviews.title: Edger doesn't really work well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good trimmer. However, the wheel for the mini mower has to be manually taken off and it isn't the easiest procedure. They get stuck on sometimes. Also, the edger does not seem to work very well. I tried it and the metal guide causes the string to cut the lawn far away from the sidewalk edge and grass excess grass does not really come out very easy. Very disappointing considering this was one of the main features that guided my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim St. John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this product. It is the most versatile trimmer I have ever used and it is so lightweight it's remarkable. I have a little over 500 feet of concrete, 18 trees and shrubs, 6 storm drains, and 3 utility poles to trim around and it does the job with 2 fully charged batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jpabshire

customer_reviews.title: 2 yards every weekend with this tool.
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight weed eater is ideal for small too large yards. Easy to carry and maneuver. Wheel attachment makes it a good edger. Cheaper to refill the line spools than to buy replacements. Simple and easy to use. Lost the spool cap but found replacement part on Amazon for cheap. Would recommend this for anyone who’s fed up with gas & oil machines that need the carburetor adjusted every season, or just has a small yard and doesn’t want to mess with gasoline.
customer_reviews.author: Jester67

customer_reviews.title: It Worx!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for around a month now and absolutely love it. The edging function with the wheels is impeccable. I had been using a battery powered trimmer that I purchased last year and it is difficult to use due to it’s size and weight. Also, I can NEVER get the line to advance. Somehow the folks at WORX have invented a trimmer that will advance line with little effort and it works great. For this reason I’m sold!
customer_reviews.author: Raphael E. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: No more chords to drag and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I trashed my old one immediately! This thing is so light, I don’t need the wheels. The spools are small but one spool did my whole lawn and fence border on 1/4 acre. I was able to intrically whack around the above ground pool too. Takes a little getting used to but the more you us the feed button you are drawn into its magic. I will be buying all the other attachments because to me, the battery is the main unit and everything else is an attachment. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Battery life improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in battery life. Didn't want to repair my old gas edger/weed wacker so hoping I could replace with this electric based on good reviews. My house is average 5,000 sq ft. Biggest disappointment is battery life. Had to charge 6 times in 2 days to complete my house. This is with 2 batteries. Each charge only lasted 10-15 min. Typically takes me 30min with gas one. Go with 40v if you're using electric.
customer_reviews.author: CrisA

customer_reviews.title: Machine Hater Loves This Product
customer_reviews.text: My heart sinks whenever I have to buy, open, operate and fool with any equipment. I am not dumb, but have had many struggles with getting machines to work. After running this thing, I am beginning to think this was not ALL ME. Rather some lousy designs and products meant for bigger, stronger, younger people. This guy comes out of box easy to work, light weight, everything self evident. (Which is good, because manual could be better.) And it really does the job. I have 300 ft of electric fencing to keep clean and one fully charged battery does it all. No Round-up guys!
customer_reviews.author: artichoke

customer_reviews.title: Love this weed eater and want to get worx blower
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman who really hasn't had to do lawn work before. I'm 54 and my man did it for years. He was " maintenance" and I was " house keeping"!!! Sadly, he passed away and I'm not mechanically inclined. To the point, this works Great!!!! I like that it self feeds the string! I've had others and it's a pain in the butt to adjust for me anyway. I'm really happy with this weed eater!!!!! I haven't quite got the hang of the edger. I'm sure I'm doing something wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Liam A.

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: When It arrived, it was so light I thought it was a toy! But this little trimmer has turned out to be the best trimmer I've ever owned (and I've owned a lot of them over the years). One battery charge is enough to trim around the front lawn and the extra battery does the back. The little wheels are great for edging the sidewalk and driveway. I would highly recommend this tool and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Papaw of 1-2-3-4-5-6-?-

customer_reviews.title: Tough little work horse
customer_reviews.text: Okay folks this is one little work horse! Was a little leary about buying a battery operated anything, much less a weed wacker. Alas my shoulder couldn't pull start my gas powered one. So here i am telling you that its well worth its cost. I mainly bought it for around my flower beds. On a whim i decided to try it out in an area that seldom gets cut down. And i was not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: i sisson

customer_reviews.title: not a great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I really hate to write bad reviews but this trimmer just doesn't make it. the feed system for the string hardly works. when I use it I have to continually manually feed the string. I have tried all the trouble shooting hints to make it work but to no avail. sorry I can't recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Lael Williams

customer_reviews.title: This little trimmer is a godsend
customer_reviews.text: This little weed trimmer is a godsend and a far cry from the gas-powered, hard-to-handle trimmers I used in the past. I’m 5’3” and love all the ways you can adjust the length and angles of different components for easier handling. The auto-feed feature never gets hung up, retwining the trimmer doesn’t require a blood sacrifice as payment, and the battery life of just one battery pack is truly excellent for my half acre of yard. Also, this trimmer doesn’t shake you to death and is amazingly lightweight. I’d purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is not the most high tech or high power piece of equipment, but for the price it does more than enough. I use it as a weed-wacker around my 1 acre farm and it does just fine. The battery does drain fairly fast, but it comes with two so it's a non-issue for me. The extension shaft is a little finicky though and I have to adjust it frequently while in use because it won't lock into place.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay B

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike others who complain of the battery life, I actually don’t have a problem with that. What I do have a problem with is that the line does not feed when you tap it on the ground. You have to manually pull the line out and quite often, which makes it a pain in the butt
customer_reviews.author: DavE

customer_reviews.title: A battery that lasts woohoo!
customer_reviews.text: We have a corner lot, so a lot of trimming. Battery lasts the whole 30 minutes it takes me( I’m thorough) with power left over! I love it. I’m short so adjustable shaft is a must. Gas powered ones are just too heavy for me. And cords are a pain to drag around all over the yard. Just have to get the line thickness figured out as the one that comes with it is a tad wimpy. So far the WORX trimmer is a gem.
customer_reviews.author: @ragamuffin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it deceptive the way it is packaged  you can pickup what you need at a box stores
customer_reviews.text: So after sifting through all of the great advertising and options of stuff and loading and unloading the cart. I inadvertently buy a battery less unit. Why in the hell do I want to spend $70 on a widget to look at. If you are stupid like me to buy it you deserve to hang on the wall and look at it. And you want another 79$ for the battery . ?? Heads up. You are getting your piece of artlessness back. Recommended that you only sell the full package of that is worth anything .
customer_reviews.author: Theresa B.

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and operate for weeding around flower beds, etc. Has wheels so you don't have to hold in the air for a long time while you are operating! Can also be used as a edger! This is the second one I have bought. The other lasted several years! I like that it is so light weight and battery operated, and it came with two batteries!
customer_reviews.author: MISSY

customer_reviews.title: An overall good trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer replaces my 8-year-old Worx trimmer (can't recall the model number) when its battery gave up the ghost. It was a 24-volt unit, and a rebuilt battery would cost $60.00. My old trimmer performed perfectly, but I decided to replace it with a new unit. The WORX WG170 GT Revolution is not quite the quality of my old trimmer, but it's getting the job done, and cost significantly less. The two 20-volt batteries are a necessity, due to their short run time compared to my old 24-volt battery. I like WORX products - I own their 20-volt blower - and will continue to recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DaveR

customer_reviews.title: When I try the mini-mower position it does not stay locked collapses
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the mini-mower position but the locking mechanism collapses As good as my old one...do not buy for the mini-mower feature
customer_reviews.author: Adam Reed

customer_reviews.title: I love this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to hold with lots of size options. The batteries go "non stop" for about 25 minutes and I have 3 of them so I figure that is really all the mowing I want to do at a time, and I can start charging immediately as they go down and have them charged in time to do another round (if I want to) later in the day
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is about an hour, maybe longer. Charges quickly. It's nice and light which is important when doing a lot of yard work. I get my line from the worx website and pay about $5 for line which is actually just covering the postage. So far all is working and I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I've only had for a few weeks but so far I am extremely pleased. Very light weight and so easy to use. I've used 3 times so far on this battery charge. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: TPyers

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is absolutely horrendous. Luckily bought a second one but neither battery lasted 18 minutes, second battery was just 15 minutes, with both being fully charged and that was just weed whacking around the house. I can’t fathom what the battery life would be if using the edger part of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great item, I correctly advertised by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This item is incorrectly advertised. This is not the WG170 and does not have the 4ah batteries as the wg170. This is an overpriced wg163 with 2ah batteries. The trimmer is good, but shame on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Backcountry Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's kind of chintzy
customer_reviews.text: It's not balanced very well, so it feels kind of awkward to move it around. Also it's not as heavy duty as it looks in the picture/description. It's kind of chintzy. I sent it back and got a gas powered trimmer which is plenty for whatever I need it for. My friend has an expensive Milwaukee trimmer that is much, much better than this, but it is still not quite enough for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jannusch

customer_reviews.title: 1 failed battery from the start
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the similar model that just quit after about 3 years. Happy with the entire purchase EXCEPT 1 of the 2 4.0 ah batteries would not charge. I had used the trimmer a little over a month with one battery. When I did need the 2nd battery, it tested bad. Since it was over 30 days, Amazon didn't cover it. I made several attempts to report this to Worx (calls, emails) with no success. The batteries are supposed to be warranted for a year so I "should" be able to get the 1 replaced. If someone could lead me in this endeavor, it would be much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Deaton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight, and great string feed!  Battery life seems OK for now.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and charged fairly quickly, Used to trim grass and weeds around lawn and it was easy to get the job done! 65 years old and have back trouble but this trimmer was light enough that I got the job done! Not made for or advertised for large jobs and tall weeds but grass clipping it does well!
customer_reviews.author: NaspeDude

customer_reviews.title: Is the same old string tool
customer_reviews.text: It was advertised as a 3 in 1, a mini mower; edger; and s string tool, it is the same old string tool, which I hate. I have one in my garage that is hard to use, the string breaks often, was looking for a metal tool. Additionally, this tool is all plastic. Have not used it yet, but not what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT POWERFUL ENOUGH
customer_reviews.text: I Have some grass that is about 7 inches high due to rain that a mower can't reach. At the edge of the road. Takes many tries to cut a small clump. I like the weight of the unit but do not recommend on any heavy grass. Had good instructions on set up. would be great on very light trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Great product, as adverised!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like everything about the Worx trimmer. It is lightweight and does a fine job of trimming my 1.1 acre property and 4600 square foot home using about 2/3 of one 4 amp-hour battery. The auto feeding string has worked flawlessly in several uses. The lifetime supply of free string spools is a real bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Green

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 4 cycle a few years ago and my back always hurt after using it. It is nothing but a hassle. This is so much more convenient. Battery lasts a long time. Spools last a long time and are simple to use. It came with two batteries. Used the first button three times before changing to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M Fatheree

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions.
customer_reviews.text: All went well with the WORX trimmer / everything else. All claims were met with ease. The only problem, as with many items sold these days, is the illustrations in the owners manual. It seems like they are drawn by either an MIT astrophysics major, or a five year old child! Like I said, it's not only WORX. Many companies these days must hire the same people to do this job.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Easy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get a battery operated weed eater. I have back problems and the last weed eater I had killed my back. I’ve been paying someone to weed eat my tiny bit of yard and just felt I was wasting money. This weed eater is light, easy to use, and I earned my money back in two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Black

customer_reviews.title: great  product
customer_reviews.text: I have other worx product and love all of them. I purchased the trimmer/edger when my SunJoe trimmer spool cap came off and broke. They do not make the part to buy so you cannot use the item at all. I bought the Worx because the parts are readily available from the company and from Amazon. It is not too heavy but is heavier that the SunJoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Duty Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: My home sits in a subdivision on a 1/3 acre lot and does not have that much to trim. I selected the (2) 2-amp battery model. I had the option of buying a (1) 4-amp model, but it weighed more due to the larger battery pack. Occasionally, I will need the 2nd battery to finish the job. I love the sturdiness and light weight design. The string feeding system works great!
customer_reviews.author: EngineerinMe

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. But the ergonomically poor. Especially for left handlers. Disappointed on the discomfort to operate. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have... it really does work great.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is no problem. You also get an extra one. My yard is large, it cuts through just about anything. The wheels are an added bonus. My lines along the lawn are tight. I had many trimmers..this one is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Handy Dandy weed wacker
customer_reviews.text: I love this, I have another one but it doesnt have the mini mower, I actually bought for that feature, I use it in my backyard being alone just me and my dogs, it works great to go around my shed and under garden decor..great edger as well..
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weed eater for Florida lawn
customer_reviews.text: This is the brand my husband requested and it wasn’t found in local stores so we bought it on Amazon and we’re very happy with this one
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Kay

customer_reviews.title: How easy it is to trim & edge with this unit!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best trimmer I’ve ever owned. I edged my entire front & back yard without having to rethread string and that has NEVER happened in my lifetime. The wheels are great for ending up with a nice straight edge. There are many adjustments to fit ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn E. Coogan

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless weed whacker.
customer_reviews.text: Setup took 5 minutes to change a screw. I like how the unit lies flat and can easily hangs on the wall. Decent power, a little less than my former electric weeder. Can just grab this unit off the wall and start working. No untangling long cords. No more excuses for letting the grass grow tall.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works real good
customer_reviews.text: I like that you don't have to have an extension cord . works good but I couldn't get the line to feed out. also the reels with the cord are to small . don't have enough in them. I ran out fast.
customer_reviews.author: rachael polite

customer_reviews.title: great for edging
customer_reviews.text: First off my yard is .7 acres and I live on a cul de sac with a lot of curb to trim. My gas powered weed wacker died after 12 years and so I thought I would give a battery powered one a try. The Battery lasts me 2 1/2 mowings, which is way better than I thought! This weed wacker is 1/3 of the weight, and the edger works awesome, the wheels were a great idea. Down sides are: I wish I could use a thicker line and weed wacking isn't the greatest, used to a bigger head, but definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Music and Miles

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied & accomplished
customer_reviews.text: I luv it! Manageable lightweight for me I'm still learning how to maneuver it. But so far used it twice and feeling very confident to keep my yard trim. Felt very satisfied and accomplished to get my yard work done.
customer_reviews.author: GeekYgadget-gal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t get the job done
customer_reviews.text: They make this seem like a fantastic product and sadly it just doesn’t live up to the manufacturers claims. It is lightweight and easy to maneuver. It doesn’t trim well and at all leaving the yard looking sloppy. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tera

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the weedeater. It is light enough as a women to manage better. I like the fact that is electric and you don’t have to buy gas. One charge is enough to do my smaller property. I think the product is a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hauptfleisch

customer_reviews.title: Great for light trimming
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is fantastic. You just have to keep in mind its NOT a gas trimmer so dont expect to cut down baby trees or do extreme edging. I was surprised by its capability and how light it is. Definately worth every penny. No more messing with that 2 stroke noise maker that never wants to start!
customer_reviews.author: dntbdmb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Not too noisy.  Not heavy.
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to use than the gas powered or even the electric trimmers. This trimmer is very adjustable and is lightweight and easy to handle. Completed my small yard (30ft by 40ft) on 2 batteries on full charge. So nice not to be cranking or yanking around a heavy electric cord. Enjoyed yardwork for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Like This Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I think the wheels for edging were a nice touch, but the spools for this trimmer string run out TOO FAST!! It's no wonder you made those spools so small so one would HAVE to buy 12 at a time just so you can use 6 of them to trim your lawn once !!! I am going to write to WORX and tell them the same thing I'm telling you. This is NOT worth 100 bucks. There is also the matter of short battery life.
customer_reviews.author: mrmusic248

customer_reviews.title: Ţ
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'3" and have never used a battery powered trimmer. I have always used a gas powered model. It is very hard to use that since i am SJOET and lack ipper bldy strenfth ams jabe has a past lower bqck sirhweu that has ledt me
customer_reviews.author: TONYA

customer_reviews.title: Keep Scrolling
customer_reviews.text: It’s light, easy to put together. Chews the grass. The 1st spoil of string melted into each other. The “edger” doesn’t edge unless you go over it 1st with heavy duty equipment. Maybe it’s good for maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: MorganFSU

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, durable, and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Updated from 4 year old unit and the improvements are great. Loved the old model but this one is super. Bought the first Worx trimmer because my Grandson kept tearing up the gas units (2 per season). It lasted 2 years with him using it and 2 more. The batteries were wearing down so started looking at the new model.
customer_reviews.author: David Lahey

customer_reviews.title: Stick to the original if possible.
customer_reviews.text: the original was better. The edging ability is lessened with the guard. And the string gets eaten faster with this edger. This edger seems to be bulkier. And my petite wife (5'2" / 90lbs) has a harder time handling it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Like it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much! Would be nice if the battery lasted a little longer, but I do have 3 batteries and 3 Chargers so it’s not much of a problem. I think it’s a good product and hopefully will last several seasons
customer_reviews.author: Lilybean

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I love this grass . trimmer I purchased one of these about 7 years ago and it was used heavy. I had to replace it this year.I would purchase another in 7 years and I did recommend it to quit a few people and they love it too. If your doudtful don’t be, it’s easy and reliable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Does not edge as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor edger. Will not cut thru thick crabgrass or even the ground, if you can get to it. Bought it for edging and it does not work for that purpose. Returned unit.
customer_reviews.author: Phil62

customer_reviews.title: This product really works well!
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure that a reasonably priced cordless grass trimmer/edger would really do the job. I have been very surprised and pleased how well this product does. I also purchased the WORX WG322 20v cordless chainsaw and have found it to do the job also. The batteries last a long time and are quick to charge. If you are looking for a good cordless product I would suggest both the trimmer/edger and the chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: DEP

customer_reviews.title: Great product easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product super easy to use and lightweight enough for myself ( who has a bad shoulder ) and my 77 year old mother can even use this is so easy!! Would recommend for anyone looking for something lightweight and has good battery life
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived on time in good condition
customer_reviews.text: when I started using this weed wacker It was much better that all previous items that I used. If you want light weight, easy to use tool for grooming your yard this is the product to get. Battery life is very good. Buy it you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: frank j. gallagher

customer_reviews.title: it was awesome I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It works amazing it’s wonderful to not have to deal with gas and oil and pull starting you just adjust the length to how you want it adjust the head at the angle you want to push the button and go! I went all the way around my house all the way around the trampoline around the hedges under the trampoline it was awesome I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Judy's Stop-N-Shop

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little bit flimsy, but for the price the battery life is pretty good and so far it's working well. Thick brush will definitely kill the battery a lot faster than grass
customer_reviews.author: The Stig

customer_reviews.title: hard to set edger on right side
customer_reviews.text: I got WORX WG170 GT yesterday, I am trying to make trimmer,mini mover,it worked,but I am trying to set edger, it did not on right position,can you tell me that how to set edger on right position,I mean I want the edger on right side when I am holding the shaft & auxiliary handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Chang

customer_reviews.title: NOT a mower!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is NOT a mower. It’s an edger/ weed eater. If you use it to edge/weed eat, it works fine. The battery lasts about 25-35 minutes. Only con is the battery takes hours to charge. If you use it to mow your lawn, you won’t get very far. It DOES cut thick grass but the battery drains so fast trying to mow.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th different worx product. Love the fact you can trade out batteries if you have a big area to weed eat. Be glad to get some more different ones especially the 2-1 drill.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P. Pettigrew

product_meta.title: WORX WG170 GT Revolution 20V 12" Grass Trimmer/Edger/Mini-Mower 2 Batteries & Charger Included, Black and Orange
product_meta.description: Style:2 X 20V 2.0Ah Batteries Included| Pattern Name:RevolutionThe WORX cordless 20-volt MAX lithium powered string trimmer delivers new levels of power, precision and function. Those 20 volts of MAX lithium battery power give the WG170 GT Revolution longer run times and more power. The 12-inch cutting diameter means more trimming in less time. Convert to an edger in seconds, with dual-positioned in-line wheels that make edging a breeze. The innovative Command FeedTM instant line feeding system keeps you productively moving on your lawn projects. Make easy height adjustments to the telescopic shaft using the quick-release trigger lever. Turn the trimmer head with an easy pull and turn to lock and convert to edging in seconds. The Max lithium battery power means more battery capacity, longer runtimes, no self-discharge, no slow loss of power, less weight, more power and quicker charging times. Charge the battery within 3 hours and it’ll be ready when you need it with no-self discharge. From function to features, the 20V WORX GT Revolution features 100% single-line feed which means no bumping to extend the line. An adjustable space guard not only helps protect vegetation, it also acts as an edger guide. A front auxiliary handle has 7 locking adjustments for maximum comfort while trimming, edging, or mowing. Weighing in at less than 6 lbs., the GT 20V trimmer and edger lets you create a professional-looking yard with less work, less fatigue and in less time.
feature_bullets: 3-in-1: The GT is a trimmer, wheeled in-line edger, and mini-mower. It saves you time (it converts in seconds) and money (you don’t have to buy 3 separate tools)
Command Feed: The innovative push-button spool system feeds line when you need it. No bumping needed. Just press the button, and keep trimming
Telescopic shaft: Slide it open or closed to accommodate taller or shorter users, and the seven-position adjustable handle lets you find a grip that works for you
Edging wheels: Twin rubber wheels keep the edger smooth and steady, giving you straighter lines with less resistance
Do it all with the same battery: Do it all with Worx PowerShare, the only cordless tool platform that uses the same battery to power 20V and 40V tools

90° head & flower guard: The cutting-head pivots so you can get into hard-to-reach places and trim and mow on sloped land without a problem. Trim up close to plants and flowers and other valuable landscaping features without worrying about nicking them
What's included: GT revolution 3-in-1 trimmer, 2 20V 2.0Ah PowerShare batteries, 20V battery charger, support wheels, 3 trimmer spools, and spool holder

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,180 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
